alert.note: Alert for DeWitt (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 10:17AM CST until January 28 at 4:07AM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Sandies Creek Near Westhoff affecting DeWitt County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Guadalupe River Near Cuero affecting DeWitt County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Guadalupe River near Cuero. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Flooding extends into floodplain above Cuero threatening livestock. US Hwy 183 North at Hochheim has water on or crossing the roadway. Highway likely closed. At 29.0 feet, FM 766 (Hell`s Gate Bridge) closed due to water across roadway between Ed Blackwell Lane and Hell`s Gate Bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CST Thursday the stage was 25.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 19.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM CST Thursday was 25.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 28.4 feet tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (9 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Guadalupe River Cuero 24.0 25.2 Thu 9 am CST 28.3 25.8 18.9 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 430 AM CST.
